Comment: I‚Äôm with you 100%.  The Democrats abdicated the entirety of social media and telecommunications to the Republicans once the fairness doctrine was repealed.  Instead of doing what the Republicans did which is take the opportunity to buy up every possible media outlet and broadcast the same message across all of them, Democrats basically relied upon the ‚Äúgoodness of people‚Äú and ‚Äúfreedom of the markets‚Äú.  As a result, the only messaging platform the Democrats have now is NPR, which is also being forced to a conservative bent by the Republicans as well as a scattering of smaller media companies.  Everything else has been co-opted and taken over by Republicans and this was the plan.  Read the Powell memo.  If the only source of information for Americans comes from a particular political viewpoint, America is going to shift towards that viewpoint. The fairness doctrine prevented any single  political viewpoint from dominating, with that gone and with all restrictions on ownership of media companies removed Republicans saw the opportunity to go out and buy up everything and use those messaging platforms to change public opinion.  In the meantime, Democrats sat around with their thumbs up their asses.
